verbose_text: The high structural similarity of the R-domain emphasizes that the disulphide used to constrain the R-domain in ColE9 has not introduced any distortion into the structure, which is reinforced by the observation that the thermodynamics of BtuB receptor binding for the disulphided colicin are essentially identical with the wild-type protein [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: BtuB receptor-binding for the disulphided colicin
